data.title: Borussia Dortmund’s Sebastian Kehl Scores Beautiful Long-Range Volley
data.meta_description: Paste Magazine is your source for the best music, movies, TV, comedy, videogames, books, comics, craft beer, politics and more. Discover your favorite albums and films.
data.text:
The tragedy of Borussia Dortmund’s underachieving season in 2014-15 is that it made so many people forget how fun this team is. This goal from Sebastian Kehl offered a glimpse of those bygone days.

Dortmund were at home in the DFB-Pokal quarterfinals against TSG Hoffenheim yesterday. Down 2-1 at halftime, BVB managed to find an equalizer in the second half and force extra time. As the latter half of extra time started, both sides were getting punch-drunk, and it was looking like something magical would need to happen to avoid a penalty shootout.

Enter Kehl, stage right.

From distance. Through traffic. Pinging off the inside of the post. In a cup tie. In extra time. And it was the gamewinner. Really, this goal had it all.

Dortmund will face fierce rivals Bayern Munich in the semifinals on April 28. In the (admittedly unlikely) event they survive that encounter, they’ll face either Wolfsburg or second division side Arminia Bielefeld in the final on May 30.
